echo.message: Useful targets:
pkg: distclean then package everything up (installer, clean tarball, update tarball)
dist: pkg and javadoc
installer: build the GUI installer
installer-freebsd: build the GUI installer (FreeBSD only)
installer-linux: build the GUI installer (Linux only)
installer-osx: build the GUI installer (OSX only)
installer-windows: build the GUI installer (Windows only)
tarball: tar the full install into i2p.tar.bz2 (extracts to build a new clean install)
updater: Package the built files in i2pupdate.zip (extracts safely over existing installs)
updater200: Updater compressed with pack200 (creates i2pupdate200.zip, 60% smaller)
updaterWithJavadoc: updater including the javadocs, for display in the console
updaterWithJetty: Updater including Jetty
updaterWithJettyFixes: updater including local jetty patches
updaterWithGeoIP: updater including GeoIP Files
updaterWithJettyFixesAndGeoIP
updaterWithJettyFixesAndJbigi
updaterSmall: updater with the essentials only - no SAM, i2psnark, SusiMail, SusiDNS, news.xml, or history.txt
updaterRouter: updater with the i2p.jar and router.jar only
distclean: clean up all derived files
desktopgui: generate a standalone desktopgui install
i2psnark: generate a standalone i2psnark install
justBOB: generate a standalone BOB-one.jar
javadoc: generate javadoc for the entire project into ./build/javadoc
slackpkg: generate Slackware packages in ./Slackware/i2p and ./Slackware/i2p-base
debianhowto: instructions on building Debian packages
debian: generate Debian packages in ../
run "ant debianhowto" for instructions
debian-clean: rollback debian specific patches and run the "distclean" target (done automatically at the end of the "debian" target)
poupdate: update the .po files for translators
pkg-portable-win32: build a minimum portable version for win32
To build debian packages, you must make sure that you have
the necessary build-dependencies installed.
The packages required to build can be found in the file
"debian/control" in both the Build-Depends and Build-Depends-Indep fields.
In addition to those packages, be sure to install "fakeroot",
"quilt" and "build-essential"!
The following command will install all dependencies for you:
apt-get install debhelper ant debconf default-jdk gettext libgmp3-dev po-debconf fakeroot build-essential quilt
Once the dependencies are installed, run "ant debian"
to patch the source and build the packages.
